projects.desc:
My World Works (previously: The World Works) is an interactive map, and a massive personal undertaking, which can be used to analyze entire economies across over 140 different countries. The inspiration behind this project was to help individuals optimize their work/life balance by comparing cost of living side-by-side with localized workforce statistics.

Hosted on AWS free-tier EC2. At the moment I have no intent to maintain this as anything more than a personal side-project for learning Go/React fullstack development. The scope is just too large.

To fully demonstrate this app, choose The United States from the Economics tab. Collecting this much data is a long and labor intensive process. At this time, only the USA is capable of displaying every feature from the app.
projects.caption: Demo for the Y-Combinator Summer 2021 application

projects.desc:
The Digital Toolbox is a learning management platform for k-12 mathematics, and is the epicenter of my longest-running role as a web developer. The app boasts 4 separate account types which can support a variety of users from private educators and homeschoolers to public and charter schools. They can create, manage and monitor virtual classrooms using Demme Learning's curricula. I orchestrated numerous upgrades, including the introduction of a Vue.js as the frontend framework, and introduced many useful applets including their worksheet generator, an open source Angular application that I repurposed to fit their curriculum materials. I also implemented Demme Learning's current Single Sign-On solution, as well as performed numerous Linux Administration tasks to keep their servers hardened and capable of adapting to increased server load and upgraded technologies.

I began working on this project as the sole developer of their team. Since then I've introduced numerous modernizations to the underlying stack, and have more recently began working with a team of developers as the Demme Learning domain continues to evolve. I also build and maintain their administrative backend, which hosts custom tooling built by myself, which primarily supports customer service and accounting in their day to day tasks.
projects.caption: Just a peek at the cloud filesystem tool, built into the Toolbox's admin domain. Developed quite early in my career.

projects.desc: I've always been interested in 3D graphics, and over the years I've taken a few courses in mathematics to support this interest. I've developed 3 graphics pipelines, each with a different underlying API where I've taken my programming skills to the forefront of game development from scratch. I don't plan on building my own games just yet. For now these rendering engines keep me up to speed with the latest advancements in graphics APIs and allow me to utilize my linear algebra studies in a 3D context.
projects.caption: Part of an arcade series I'm working on.

title: Personal Space Invaders - Python Game with Sentiment Analysis

projects.desc:
Personal space invaders started as a silly idea turned proof-of-concept. A Python PyGame client accesses the Twitter API using a Flask app on Heroku, conducts sentiment analysis upon fetched tweets to determine the difficulty of the gameplay, and proceeds to turn each tweet into a game of Space invaders; where each tweet can be destroyed character by characters by players.

This game was never released beyond my own desktop for legal reasons.
projects.caption: Passing judgements upon our former president, programatically, so you don't have to.

projects.desc:
Doublevision is a sandbox for combining the artificial intelligence and machine learning capabilities of OpenCV, with the GPIO capabilities of Arduino and Raspberry Pi. I've added the proper CMakeLists.txt in order to build your programs with a simple call to make. Also included is the ASIO header library to add networking to your projects.

What is most exciting about this project is that it uses a relatively new standard of interacting with the Raspberry Pi's GPIO interface, known as libgpio. This new lib deprecated the previous method of GPIO access by a longshot! Development can be done on any Raspberry Pi 3b+ or later.
projects.link: Check out the Doublevision repo on GitHub

projects.desc: This project allowed me to deep dive into both operating system design and embedded systems. Lyros is a multithreaded operating system from scratch that specifically targets the Texas-Instrument ARM Cortex-M series of microcontrollers.

title: Harvard CS50-AI
desc: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence with Python. This course taught me the concepts and algorithms at the foundation of modern artificial intelligence. I took my education in AI 1 step further and began using Jupyter Labs as a platform for which to practice ML concepts.

title: Harvard CS50
desc: Introduction to Computer Science. Taught by the mighty David Malan, Gordon McKay Professor of the Practice of Computer Science. This course was so amazing that I began taking it a 2nd time. I was a very active tutor on the CS50 reddit long after completion which subsequently prompted the creation of my WordPress blog.

title: Harvard CS50-B
desc: Computer Science for Business Professionals. Also taught by David Malan, this class focused more on the abstractions which computer science offers in your business domain. It covers everything from network architecure to cloud computing and security.

title: CompTIA A+ (2017 - 2021)
desc: Certifies general knowledge & practices in hardware, networking and software in the field of Information Technology.

title: CompTIA CySA+ (2018 - 2021)
desc: A much more involved certificate, the CySA+ demonstrates knowledge and practical skills in the fields of Cyber Forensics and Cyber Defense. Through this certification I have learned how to utilize many of the tools available in the Ethical Hacker's toolbelt.
